comments: I love the way he teaches. His lectures are very interesting. I wasnt into architecture at all but he talks about the buildings and their architecture somehow that you\'d want to know more and go to class each session. DO NOT buy any of the books he asks for. I bought all three and didnt even open them once. 3 tests but are easy and 2 extra credit.

Important to attend. 3 tests, pretty straightforward if you pay attention. Reading is not mandatory but helps with the tests. Tests are short answer. Do not need to memorize the exact date but gives a ten year leeway. Fun field trip to SF. two papers, individual, not group. He knows what he\'s talking about.

I figured this teacher would be very easy due to his reviews. This was my first semester at SJSU coming from community college. I found he graded somewhat hard on written test responses and the essay. There were 3 tests a long with a research paper. You need to have a strong understanding of the buildings to do well.

Raynsford is very passionate about the history of architecture, I learned so much, as his lectures are very interesting, and loves what he teaches. I will continue to more classes with this instructor,

Somewhat boring lectures, but very good teacher. He is very clear and straightforward about what will be on quizzes and assignments, so there\'s no tricking you there. Go to his lectures and be prepared to do a quite a bit of memorization for exams, and you will do fine.

Prof Raynsford is clearly very passionate teacher and knows the subject well. I found his lectures very engaging, even though he sometimes paused to ask the class a question, and no-one would answer (too tired or too shy) so he would wait until they did *groan*. Pay attention, memorize the stuff he says to, and you\'ll pass.

One of the best teachers at SJSU. I took 3 arth history class with him. Very boring subject but you will learn a lot from him. He is very knowledgeable of what he is teaching and he is very organized. (Must)Go to classes, take good notes, study your notes, write the essays and follow his directions. You will get an A.

Raynsford is clearly passionate about architecture, and I learned a ton from his lectures. There was no textbook for his class, just some journal articles, but this made it critical to attend class if you wanted a good grade on exams. There wasn\'t a lot of homework, either.
This course should be easy as long as you attend class, take good notes, study, and do all the assignments. Also, he isn\'t a hard grader.

He is very clear and doesn\'t play games with you. No surprises at the exams. As long as you go to classes, take good notes, and memorize what he asks you to (there are study lists)before exams, you will do more than just fine. He grades easy, too. A very passionate teacher. Art history is boring but that\'s just how it is.

I have no interest in art, but this class was not as bad as I had anticipated. Professor is very sweet and helpful! He is lenient with due dates & grades fairly. Lectures are boring. I got A\'s on the essays and a B and C on the exams. I received an A- overall without ever reading the book. If you have good memorization this class will be a breeze!

Great class, if you want to learn. Very helpful during and after class. Instructor wants you to understand, not just go to class and memorize the stuff. Quiz is too much to memorize such as dates,artist. Papers do help you understand, but cut down on composition grammar. Oh well that is part of the college experience..Yes, would take him again.

Lectures are sometimes boring, but very informative. Tests are based on what he says in lecture, a list of works handed out ahead of time and vocabulary. Very open to questions during and after class and helps in any way he can. Only two papers, which are very straightforward. Great professor.

Lectures were nothing special. Group paper topics were limited and didn\'t spark my interest. Having to do a group presentation made me feel like I\'d taken 5 steps back into high school. The test format was the worst part of the course. They were strictly timed. Definitions needed to be regurgitated verbatim back on the page. This taught me nothing.

Very helpful, has a very clear voice, he is not boring the content is boring. He is just doing his job. Slides are interesting if you really want to learn to analyze art. Quiz and group paper are just part of the program, remember your in a university not high school.

Like it was said, he\'s a nice guy, and he will help you if you need it. But his class is unbelievably BORING! Half the class is sleep and the rest have their eyes glued to their laptops. So boring. And save your money on the books, you don\'t need them. The group papers are so lame and not interesting. Over all class is boring. Don\'t like it.

Teacher himself is a nice guy and will help you if you need help, but the class itself can be extremely boring. Everything you learn in this class will go through one ear and out the other. What he teaches won\'t really be used in his exams. Easy A? Yeah if you know how to BS work. 2 Essays, not extremely hard. Take the class if its only for GE.

Don\'t buy the books, waste of money. You don\'t even need them. Just pay attention to his ppts, take notes, and you\'ll do well. There\'s a lot of group work, like the 2 papers. Make sure everyone does their work. He\'s picky about papers, but you get to rewrite the 1st one. 3 exams, just memorize definitions and concepts. easy class.

Attend class, take notes, and learn it without the need to open the book! Great class! Take It! 2 papers: unfortunately they are group work! but good thing is that each individual is graded on his/her own work! Great Class to Take!
He is annoying and boring. An easy A...just know how to BS all the work. Dont buy the book you absolutely dont need it..group papers only 2 pages each
